feed.title: NewsTracker: egypt
feed.subtitle: This is a news tracking demo

entry.title: In Egypt, ex-military men fire up Islamist insurgency
entry.summary:
They pose a danger to U.S. ally Egypt with their knowledge of the Arab world's biggest army, provide militants with training and strategic direction, and even carry out suicide bomb attacks against government officials.

Men like Ashmawy, who is on the run, are especially troubling for Egypt which is struggling to contain a complex web of militants who roam from the Sinai to Libya, another hub for extremists.

Ashmawy's neighbors in Cairo's Nasr City district, home to many army officers, never suspected he would become one of Egypt's most wanted men.

entry.title: Egypt rakes billions in Gulf aid that boosts its president
entry.summary:
The gathering of royals, heads of state, top international officials and businessmen was also an opportunity for el-Sissi to put behind him criticism over the military's 2013 ouster of Egypt's elected president, Islamist Mohammed Morsi.

Next at the podium was the crown prince of Saudi Arabia, Prince Muqrin, who announced another $4 billion in aid to Egypt.

"To stand by Egypt is to breathe life into the future of the (Arab) nation," the UAE's prime minister and ruler of Dubai, Sheikh Mohammed bin Rashid Al Maktoum, told the assembly.

President Abdel-Fattah el-Sissi made his case for the world's support, depicting Egypt as vital to regional stability and a bulwark against Islamic militancy.

entry.title: Moody's raises Egypt's credit rating, says economy improved
Moody's raises Egypt's credit rating, says economy improved
entry.summary: In a statement, it ranked Egypt at B3 on its scale - speculative and subject to high credit risk - with a stable outlook, an improvement from its previous classification of Caa1.

entry.title: Egypt photojournalist describes detention of over 600 days
entry.summary: The Committee to Protect Journalists said in December that at least 12 journalists, including three Al-Jazeera journalists are detained in Egypt.

entry.title: Egypt photojournalist describes detention of over 600 days
AP PHOTOS: Powder-covered workers toil in Egypt's quarries
entry.summary: MINYA, Egypt (AP) - In the desert of southern Egypt, workers in limestone pits look as though they stepped out of a blizzard, covered in the white powder of the stones that are the economic lifeblood of this region.

entry.title: AP PHOTOS: Powder-covered workers toil in Egypt's quarries
entry.summary:
In this Wednesday, March 18, 2015 photo, a quarry worker keeps warm after dawn by drinking tea as he and others are transported in pick-up trucks to work in Minya, southern Egypt.

In this Wednesday, March 18, 2015 photo, quarry workers try to keep themselves warm around a bonfire as they wait for work after dawn in Shurafa village, Minya, southern Egypt.

In this Wednesday, March 18, 2015 photo, a quarry worker uses a machine with sharp rotor blades to cut through limestone pits at a quarry in the desert of Minya, southern Egypt.

In this Wednesday, March 18, 2015 photo, a quarry worker wearing a face mask to protect from dust pauses while arranging freshly cut stones at a quarry in the desert of Minya, southern Egypt.

entry.title: AP PHOTOS: Powder-covered workers toil in Egypt's quarries
entry.summary: After Egypt's 2011 uprising, quarry workers formed their first independent workers' union with the help of the charity, Wasfy says.

entry.title: AP PHOTOS: Powder-covered workers toil in Egypt's quarries
entry.summary: Here is a collection of images by Associated Press photographer Mosa'ab Elshamy of workers in the limestone quarries of southern Egypt.

entry.title: Egypt sacks 41 judges for supporting Muslim Brotherhood: judicial sources
entry.summary:
Another 10 were removed from their posts for joining the Judges for Egypt group which supported the Brotherhood even before Morsi's removal, the sources added.

Separately, security forces arrested 63 middle-level Brotherhood leaders who face charges of attacking police headquarters and inciting violence, Egypt's interior ministry said in a statement.

entry.title: Militants attack church and police in Egypt, one policeman dead
Explosion hits bridge in central Cairo, killing at least 1
entry.summary: People gather at the scene of an explosion that killed at least one person on a bridge over the Nile River, near an upscale neighborhood of Cairo, Egypt, Sunday, April 5, 2015.

entry.title: Egypt refers 187 Brotherhood supporters to military court - prosecutor
Explosion hits bridge in central Cairo, killing at least 1
entry.summary: Last week, a militant group known as Ajnad Misr, or "Egypt's soldiers," claimed responsibility for a bombing in front of Cairo University that wounded eight people, including four police officers.

entry.title: Egypt refers 187 Brotherhood supporters to military court: prosecutor
entry.summary: Military courts in Egypt tend to process cases more quickly than civilian ones.

entry.title: Egypt police raid radio station, detain rights advocate
Kerry promotes US investment in Egypt; no new military aid
entry.summary:
It must do one or other under the 2015 federal budget to unblock hundreds of millions of dollars in military aid for Egypt.

Kerry's hands are tied because the Obama administration is undecided about whether to affirm Egypt's progress on democracy and human rights or issue a national security waiver.

The administration is likewise uncomfortable with a national security declaration that would recall the decades of American support for Egypt's former autocrat Hosni Mubarak despite his government's obvious shortcomings.

entry.title: Egypt to try 48 for killing journalist, two civilians
entry.summary: Ashraf is among 10 Egyptian journalists killed in Egypt since the 2011 uprising that ousted former president Hosni Mubarak, according to New York-based Committee to Protect Journalist (CPJ).

entry.title: Rights group urges Egypt to halt executions of 6 men
Egypt's Islamic State Branch Claims Deadly Sinai Attack
Militant attacks in Egypt's volatile Sinai kills 15 Egyptian troops, 3 civilians
entry.summary:
In Washington, the State Department condemned Thursday's terrorist attack in Sinai and expressed condolences to the victims' families and Egypt.

On Tuesday, President Barack Obama released military aid to Egypt suspended after Morsi's 2013 ouster, in an effort to boost Cairo's ability to combat the extremist threat in the region.

entry.title: Gunmen kill 15 soldiers, two civilians in Egypt's Sinai
entry.summary:
Egypt is gradually recovering from years of political turmoil following the ouster of autocrat Hosni Mubarak in 2011 and foreign investors are starting to return.

In January, Islamic State's Egypt wing, Sinai Province, claimed responsibility for a series of attacks that killed at least 30 people.

entry.title: Series of deadly attacks in Egypt's Sinai Peninsula
entry.summary:
Gunmen opened fire on the soldiers at security checkpoints in Sheikh Zuweid and Rafah, the crossing point between Egypt and the Gaza Strip.

This insurgency has spread to other parts of Egypt, though attacks in bigger cities and towns are usually far less dramatic.

entry.title: Militant attacks kill 7 soldiers in Egypt's Sinai
Militant attacks kill 10 soldiers in Egypt
entry.summary: The two attacks, which also wounded 11 soldiers and several civilians, come as Egypt battles a growing insurgency in the northern Sinai, which borders Israel and the Gaza Strip.

entry.title: Al-Jazeera journalist awaiting trial in Egypt says Canada refuses to give him new passport
entry.summary:
Fahmy, who was born in Egypt and is a naturalized Canadian citizen, was freed from jail in February.

He renounced his Egyptian citizenship last year as a condition of any future release from Egypt.

Under his bail conditions, Fahmy must check in with police every day and cannot leave Egypt.

entry.title: Egypt president welcomes return of US military aid
Egypt, Nigeria led world in reported death sentences last year: report
entry.summary: Egypt and Nigeria accounted for well over 1,000 of the death sentences announced last year, more than a third of the world's total, Amnesty International says in its latest annual report on the death penalty.

entry.title: US lifts arms embargo on Egypt
Report: Egypt, Nigeria Led World in Death Sentences in 2014
entry.summary:
Egypt announced at least 509 death sentences last year, many of them in the mass trials that have been held since the ouster of Islamist President Mohammed Morsi in 2013.

Other countries resuming executions in 2014 were Jordan, Singapore, Egypt, Belarus, the United Arab Emirates and Equatorial Guinea, the report said.

entry.title: Obama ends freeze on U.S. military aid to Egypt
entry.summary:
The White House said President Barack Obama was freeing up the equipment and making other changes to military ties with Washington's long-time ally to support U.S. interests while encouraging Egypt's political reforms.

Egypt, which has worked with the United States on Middle East peace moves, is emerging from a period of domestic upheaval and is engaged in several regional conflicts, including in neighboring Libya, and fighting Islamic State militants at home.

Some restrictions were relaxed last year, but Congress made aid dependent on the U.S. Secretary of State certifying that Egypt was taking certain steps to govern democratically, a delay which angered the Egyptian government.

entry.title: Egypt, Nigeria led world in death sentences in 2014
UPDATE 2-Obama ends freeze on U.S. military aid to Egypt
entry.summary: "In this way, we will ensure that U.S. funding is being used to promote shared objectives in the region, including a secure and stable Egypt and the defeat of terrorist organizations," Meehan said in a statement.

entry.title: Obama lifts hold on U.S. military aid to Egypt
entry.summary: Obama has been reviewing military aid to Egypt since 2013 when the Egyptian army ousted former president Mohamed Mursi.

entry.title: US releases military aid to Egypt, cites national security
entry.summary: White House spokeswoman Bernadette Meehan said the assistance will help address the growth of a group in Egypt, affiliated with Islamic State militants, that has attacked Egyptian soldiers and civilians.

entry.title: US releases military aid to Egypt
entry.summary: The aid comes as Egypt is trying to play a leading role in forming an Arab military alliance that can fight terrorism in the region.

entry.title: US releases military aid to Egypt, cites national security
entry.summary: "We will continue to engage with Egypt frankly and directly on its political trajectory and to raise human rights and political reform issues at the highest levels," Meehan said.

entry.title: Obama lifts hold on U.S. military aid to Egypt
entry.summary: The United States also will target its aid toward equipment used for counterterrorim, border security, maritime security and Sinai security, and for sustaining weapons systems already used by Egypt, the White House said.

entry.title: US releases military aid to Egypt, cites national security
entry.summary:
The White House said that would make Egypt will remain the second-largest recipient of U.S. foreign military financing worldwide.

Egypt has been arguing it needs the money to face growing threats from extremists creeping over the border from lawless Libya or operating in the Sinai Peninsula, and the U.S. sees the funds as critical for stability in the volatile Middle East.

The White House said Obama also reiterated U.S. concerns about Egypt's continued imprisonment of activists and encouraged increased respect for freedom of speech and assembly.

entry.title: US releases military aid to Egypt, cites national security
entry.summary: The funds were suspended 21 months ago when el-Sissi, then military chief, overthrew Egypt's first democratically elected leader, Islamist President Mohammed Morsi.

entry.title: Obama releases military aid to Egypt that was frozen after 2013 coup, cites national security
entry.summary:
The White House says Obama is lifting the hold on sending F-16 fighter jets, tanks and other material to Egypt.

But the White House says it is not issuing a certification that Egypt has made progress toward democracy.

Egypt court frees 68 activists in rare move
Saudi Arabia, Egypt show discord over Syria
entry.summary: The agreement is a telling sign of a new determination among Saudi Arabia, Egypt and their allies to intervene aggressively in regional hotspots, whether against Islamic militants or spreading Iranian power.

entry.title: Egypt-Saudi differences over Syria, Libya raise questions over joint Arab action
entry.summary: Notably, Assad - who did not attend the summit - told Russian reporters ahead of the gathering that Egypt understands the crisis in Syria and that there is limited security cooperation between the two countries.

entry.title: Saudi Arabia, Egypt show discord over Syria
entry.summary:
He said Egypt would host a conference of Syria's opposition aimed at unifying its position for political talks.

Egypt's rhetoric has emphasized the need to preserve Syria as a bulwark against terrorists over the need to remove Assad, though the government has avoided saying that outright.

Russia is a key supporter of Assad and has strong ties to el-Sissi, who gave Putin a lavish welcome in Egypt last month.

In Libya, el-Sissi wants regional action against the growing power of Islamic militants, whom Egypt and the United Arab Emirates have already hit with airstrikes several times the past year.

entry.title: Saudi Arabia, Egypt show discord over Syria
14 killed in car crash in Egypt's southern Sohag province
entry.summary:
Deadly traffic crashes claim thousands of lives in Egypt every year.

The collisions killed about 13,000 people in Egypt in 2013.

entry.title: Egypt?s curious plan to abandon Cairo as its capital and build a new $45-billion city in the desert
entry.summary: Cairo, Egypt's teeming capital of 18 million people, is routinely criticized for its creaking infrastructure and horrendous traffic.

entry.title: Emirates forges special relationship with el-Sissi's Egypt
entry.summary:
Egypt's prime minister, Ibrahim Mahlab, had a prime speaking spot, which he used to praise the Emirates' "wise leadership" and the two nations' friendship.

A UAE government report shows that Egypt is by far the biggest single recipient of donor cash from the Emirates, with $4.6 billion distributed just in 2013, the most recent year for which data is available.

Emirati construction giant Arabtec Holding has ambitious plans for a $40 billion project to build 1 million middle-income homes across Egypt.

entry.title: Muslim Brotherhood leader sentenced to death in Egypt
entry.summary: On March 7, Egypt carried out the first execution of a man involved in violent clashes two days after Mr. Morsi's ouster.

entry.title: Egypt strikes back at Islamic State militants after beheading video, killing dozens
entry.summary:
It was the first time Egypt confirmed launching air strikes against the group in Libya, suggesting President Abdel Fattah al-Sisi is ready to escalate his battle against militants seeking to topple his government.

Egypt's military said the dawn strike hit Islamic State camps, training sites and weapons storage areas.

In a phone call to Al Arabiya television, Brigadier Saqer al-Joroushi, the commander of the air force loyal to Libya's official government, said more air strikes would be carried out in co-ordination with Egypt.

Egypt, the most populous Arab state, has not taken part directly in the US-led air strikes against Islamic State targets in Iraq and Syria, focusing instead on the increasingly complex insurgency within its own borders.

Security officials say militants based in Libya have established ties with Sinai Province, a group operating from Egypt's Sinai Peninsula that has pledged allegiance to Islamic State.

The United Arab Emirates, a close ally of President Sisi, said it "would put all its capabilities to support ... Egypt's efforts to eradicate terrorism and the violence against its citizens".

entry.title: Emirates forges special relationship with el-Sissi's Egypt
entry.summary:
In this Wednesday, March 5, 2015 photo, Egyptians walk in front of Sheikh Zayed Al Nahyan hospital in Cairo, Egypt.

In contrast, before Morsi's fall, Egypt had been in talks for several years with the International Monetary Fund for a $4.8 billion loan, but the talks never reached a deal.

The seven-state federation sees Egypt as central to regional security given its location, the size of its population and its outsize historical and cultural role.

The UAE is home to only about 9 million people, fewer than one in five of them citizens with the foreign workers and their families making up the rest - compared to Egypt's 90 million people.

Egyptian officials have said Egypt, Saudi Arabia, Kuwait and UAE were in talks late last year over creating a military pact to face militants.

entry.title: Egypt conducts second wave of strikes against Islamic State in Libya in retaliation for mass beheading of Christians
entry.summary:
Calling for an international coalition to confront the insurgency on its border, Egypt confirmed it had conducted raids in the IS-stronghold of Derna, in Libya's east, backed by Libya's air force.

An Egyptian air force fighter jet lands at an undisclosed location in Egypt following air strikes in Libya.

At least 64 militants were killed in Egypt's attacks, Libyan Air Force commander Saqer al-Joroushi told Egyptian state television, indicating further air strikes were planned for Tuesday.

Grief ... A man is comforted as he mourns the Egyptian Coptic Christians who were captured in Libya and beheaded by Islamic State jihadists, outside of the Virgin Mary church in the village of el-Aour, Egypt.

For Egypt, already fighting a terrorist insurgency in north Sinai against an IS-affiliated militia, the dangers of being drawn into the rapidly deteriorating security situation in Libya are enormous, analysts say.

If Egypt progresses from air strikes to troop deployment along its border with Libya, it would be opening a second front in its fight against terrorism, overstretching its military and drawing resources away from Sinai.

The Libyan National Army, as General Haftar calls it, is financed by Egypt, Saudi Arabia and the United Arab Emirates, analysts say, while Libya Dawn is backed by Qatar and Turkey.

entry.title: Saudis, Egypt consider intervention in Yemen, likely by air
entry.summary:
Egypt has said for months that it would act if the Houthis threaten vital shipping lanes that lead to its Suez Canal through the Gulf of Aden, an area the Houthis have already approached.

Egypt would have to send its planes to air bases in Saudi for the raids, and other countries would likely opt to do the same.

entry.title: Saudis, Egypt consider intervention in Yemen, likely by air
entry.summary: More likely now would be airstrikes by some combination of Saudi Arabia, UAE or Bahrain, all of which have advanced versions of American F-16s, or Egypt, which has large numbers of older versions.

entry.title: Saudis, Egypt consider intervention in Yemen, likely by air
entry.summary: A summit of Arab leaders being held this weekend in Egypt is due to address a proposal to create a joint Arab defense force, an idea promoted by Saudi Arabia and Egypt to intervene in regional crises.

entry.title: Egyptian leader defends Nile rights in Ethiopia's parliament
entry.summary:
El-Sissi said Wednesday in a speech before Ethiopian lawmakers that Egypt will continue depending on the Nile without being threatened by other downstream countries.

The leaders of Sudan, Egypt and Ethiopia on Monday signed an initial agreement outlining principles by which they will cooperate to use the water fairly.

entry.title: Egypt fires forensics official over comments on killed woman
entry.summary: The killing of el-Sabbagh, a mother of a young boy, at a Jan. 24 demonstration on the eve of the anniversary of Egypt's 2011 uprising, provoked intense public outcry.

entry.title: Egypt, Ethiopia hope for long-term Nile River cooperation
entry.summary: ADDIS ABABA, Ethiopia (AP) - The leaders of Ethiopia and Egypt said on Tuesday that they are hopeful talks over sharing Nile River waters will end in agreement.

entry.title: Egypt, Ethiopia hope for long-term Nile River cooperation
entry.summary: Egyptian President Abdel-Fattah el-Sissi told reporters in the Ethiopian capital of Addis Ababa, where he is on an official visit, that Ethiopia and Egypt are "on the right path to cooperation."

entry.title: Egypt, Ethiopia Hope for Long-Term Nile River Cooperation

2 soldiers killed by roadside bomb in Egypt's Sinai
Bomb kills two soldiers in Egypt's Sinai: sources
Egypt, Ethiopia and Sudan sign Nile dam accord
entry.summary: Egypt, which relies almost exclusively on the Nile for farming, industry and drinking water, has sought assurances that the dam will not significantly cut the river's flow to its rapidly growing population.

entry.title: Egypt signs up to Ethiopian Nile dam, citing trust
entry.summary:
The leaders of Egypt, Ethiopia and Sudan all gathered in Khartoum to sign the agreement of principles on Ethiopia's Grand Renaissance Dam project.

However, Egypt's President Abdel Fattah al-Sisi said on Monday that "this is a framework agreement and it will be completed".

Egypt believes its "historic rights" to the Nile are guaranteed by treaties from 1929 and 1959 which grant it 87 percent of the river's flow and the power to veto upstream projects.

In protest, Egypt withdrew from the Nile Basin Initiative (NBI), a forum to discuss management and development of the region's resources, but later resumed participation.

Sudan, like Egypt, relies on Nile resources but has said it does not expect to be affected by Ethiopia's Grand Renaissance project.

entry.title: Egypt signs up to Ethiopian Nile dam, citing trust
entry.summary:
Egypt, heavily reliant for millennia on the Nile for agriculture and drinking water, feared that the Grand Renaissance Dam would decrease its water supply.

Neither Sudan nor Egypt has signed the 2010 Nile Basin deal, however.

entry.title: Egypt, Ethiopia and Sudan sign accord over Nile waters
entry.summary: Experts have estimated that Egypt could lose as much as 20 percent of its Nile water in the three to five years needed for Ethiopia to fill the dam's massive reservoir.

entry.title: Egypt, Ethiopia and Sudan sign accord over Nile waters
entry.summary:
The dam had been an issue of contention among the three countries, with Egypt concerned it would reduce its share of the Nile established under a colonial-era agreement that gave Egypt and Sudan the main rights to exploit the river's water.

But in 2013, Ethiopia's parliament unanimously ratified a new accord that replaced previous deals that awarded Egypt veto powers over Nile projects.

They said at the time that work on the dam, some 20 kilometers (12 miles) from Sudan's eastern border, will continue during consultations with Cairo, and that experts had already agreed that the dam would not significantly affect water flow to both Egypt and Sudan.

In his speech in Khartoum, el-Sissi said that Egypt was a dry country that used its 55.5 billion cubic meter-share of the water, whereas other countries through which it flowed received much more rainfall.

entry.title: Egypt, Ethiopia and Sudan sign accord over Nile waters
entry.summary: Egypt previously had voiced fears that Ethiopia's $4.2 billion hydro-electric project would diminish its share of the Nile, which provides almost all of the desert nation's water needs.

entry.title: Egypt, Ethiopia and Sudan Sign Accord Over Nile Waters

entry.title: Egypt, Emirati developers tout nebulous plan for new capital
entry.summary:
It's everything missing from Egypt today - with a price tag of up to $80 billion.

"Real estate is now considered the engine of Egypt's growth and what better way to stimulate it, in spite of the dismal record of new desert towns to date, than to proclaim a colossal new capital?"

entry.title: Egypt to try police officer for killing female protester
entry.summary:
Amnesty International said authorities in Egypt are covering up excessive use of force by police, taking no action to rein in abuse.

Almost all of the over 100 policemen tried for killing protesters during Egypt's 2011 revolution were acquitted, with judges citing shoddy investigation or lax evidence in cases largely probed by the police themselves.

The uproar over el-Sabbagh's death prompted Egypt's President Abdel-Fattah el-Sissi to urge an investigation but he hinted that individual mistakes should not undermine public confidence in the police.

entry.title: Egypt to try police officer for killing female protester
entry.summary:
Egypt's chief prosecutor has referred a police officer to trial for the deadly shooting of a female protester killed earlier this year during a peaceful demonstration.

The statement said the defendants confessed to receiving money to plot the chaos outside the stadium in order to destabilize the country and cause a recent international donor conference hosted by Egypt to fail.

The two cases had renewed accusations from rights groups and political activists that Egypt's powerful police force enjoys almost blanket impunity.

entry.title: Egypt to try 16 over football stadium deaths

Egypt, the Arab world's most populous country, faces a power shortage causing rolling blackouts that affect tens of millions of people, one of several woes the government is addressing.

Jeff Immelt, CEO of General Electric Co., said that despite the risks, Egypt is a key piece of its global strategy, which considers opportunities over the long term.

Egypt's Gulf Arab allies promised it $12 billion in new investment and aid on Friday, as El-Sissi opened the conference to promote an ambitious recovery plan for his country's ailing economy.

Kuwait's Emir Sheikh Sabah Al Ahmad Al Sabah announced that his oil-rich nation would invest $4 billion in Egypt.

entry.title: Egypt Announces Plans to Build New Capital

A much-hyped investment conference opens in Egypt's Red Sea resort of Sharm el-Sheikh Friday, March 13, 2015.

FILE - In this March 5, 2015 file photo, a homeless Egyptian child sleeps under a bridge in Cairo, Egypt.

FILE - In this Feb. 3, 2015 file photo, stray dogs rest in front of the Pyramids of Giza on the outskirts of Cairo, Egypt.

FILE - In this March 4, 2015 file photo, an Egyptian broom vender drives his motorized tricycle in Cairo, Egypt.

President Abdel-Fattah el-Sissi has staked his legitimacy on fixing Egypt's broken economy, and it cannot be done without massive new investment.

BP said in a statement that the investment is "a vote of confidence in Egypt's investment climate."

BP Group Chief Executive Bob Dudley says the project is his company's "largest foreign direct investment in Egypt."

Egypt has already attracted some $1.3 billion in foreign investment in the first quarter of the fiscal year, Salman said.

Rising consumption has outstripped Egypt's domestic production, and over the past year Egyptians have endured prolonged power outages.

entry.title: Emirates forges special relationship with el-Sissi's Egypt

entry.title: Emirates forges special relationship with el-Sissi's Egypt
entry.summary:
The United Arab Emirates has pumped billions of dollars into Egypt and is lining up investors to try to stabilize its damaged economy, while building military cooperation.

That conference put the UAE-Egypt relationship front and center among the 80 nations attending.

The Emirates is also a key organizer of an economic development conference aimed at enticing investors to Egypt and reviving its economy, to be held next week in the Sinai resort of Sharm el-Sheikh.

The Egypt the Future investment conference's speakers list presents a who's who of the Emirati corporate elite.

Minister of State Sultan al-Jaber, an Emirati official with one of the few seats on the conference's steering committee, promised the event will be "a first step in the implementation of a larger strategy that will ensure Egypt's economic revival."

The Emirates, Saudi Arabia and Kuwait pumped billions of dollars into Egypt following the military's ouster of Islamist President Mohammed Morsi in July 2013.

entry.summary: Tuesday's statement says the tomb, found near the southern city of Luxor, dates back to the New Kingdom of the 18th Dynasty - the most famous of ancient Egypt dynasties.

entry.title: Egypt court suspends parliamentary elections
entry.summary: Egypt has not had an elected legislature since 2012, when the Supreme constitutional Court ruled that parliament's lower chamber was not constitutionally elected.

entry.title: Egypt Court Suspends Coming Elections
Egypt court ruling halts parliamentary election: judicial sources
entry.summary:
The decision by Egypt's Administrative Court came as expected after a ruling on Sunday by the Supreme Constitutional Court against an article on voting districts in an election law which heralded a likely delay to the poll.

Egypt's leaders say the election shows their commitment to democracy but critics say Sisi, who as army chief toppled his predecessor, has undermined freedoms gained after the Arab Spring revolt.

entry.title: Egypt names Cuper from Argentina to lead its soccer team
entry.summary: Egypt's team has been without a fulltime manager since American Bob Bradley quit in late 2013 after he failed to take the Pharaohs to the World Cup in Brazil.

entry.title: 11 wounded, one critically, in bomb blast near Egypt court: medics
entry.summary: Those bombs and several others that killed policemen in Cairo were claimed by the Ajnad Misr (Soldiers of Egypt) jihadist group.

entry.title: Egypt parliamentary poll set for delay after court ruling
entry.summary:
Cairo: Egypt's parliamentary poll looks set to be delayed after a court ruled part of an election law was unconstitutional and the main election committee said it was working on a new timetable for the long-awaited vote.

The latest development highlights Egypt's rocky path towards democracy since the ousting of Islamist president Mohamed Morsi in 2013 by the army after mass protests against the rule of Egypt's first democratically elected leader.

Egypt has been without a parliament since June 2012 when a court dissolved the democratically elected main chamber, reversing a major accomplishment of the 2011 uprising that toppled autocrat Hosni Mubarak.

entry.title: Egypt sentences Mohamed Badie and members of Muslim Brotherhood to death
entry.summary: Hamas is an offshoot of the Brotherhood, which the authorities have also declared a terrorist group in Egypt and have repressed systematically since the coup against Morsi.

entry.title: Egypt court lists Hamas 'terrorist group,' sentences Brotherhood members
entry.summary:
After the January decision against Hamas' Qassem Brigades, a source close to the armed wing signaled the group would no longer accept Egypt as a broker between it and Israel.

Badie has already been sentenced to multiple life terms, and was one of hundreds given the death sentence in a mass trial that drew international criticism of Egypt's judicial system.

entry.title: Egypt's resorts safe, German beauties say
entry.summary: The Tourism Ministry says 9.9 million tourists came to Egypt in 2014, a slight increase from the previous year, driven by a 47 percent surge from Eastern Europe - notably 3.1 million Russians.

entry.title: Egypt's resorts safe, German beauties say
entry.summary:
Soma Bay is part of a string of resorts billed as Egypt's "Red Sea Riviera," known for world-class diving and sandy beaches that are open year-round.

Americans and Western Europeans are still largely avoiding Egypt, in part because of government travel warnings.

entry.title: Fierce crackdown on dissent no laughing matter in Egypt
entry.summary:
Gags like this are in short supply in Egypt.

Bassem Youssef repeatedly poked fun at Mursi and became known abroad as Egypt's very own Jon Stewart -- the renown American political satirist.

entry.title: Al-Jazeera journalist optimistic Egypt retrial will clear him of wrongdoing
entry.summary: The journalists and their network said they were caught in a political dispute between Egypt and Qatar, which sponsors Al-Jazeera and had been a strong backer of Morsi during his divisive year in power.

entry.title: Al-Jazeera producer hopes to be cleared in Egypt retrial
entry.summary:
Mohammed said he spent 411 days in three different prisons in Egypt, including a maximum security facility where he had to sleep on a damp cement floor in a cell six and a half feet wide.

The Committee to Protect Journalists listed Egypt in 2014 as one of the 10 worst jailers of journalists around the world, along with China, Iran, Turkey and Ethiopia.

entry.title: Correction: Egypt story
entry.summary: CAIRO (AP) - A judicial official in Egypt has denied that the country's toppled Islamist president and a deputy leader of the Muslim Brotherhood have been referred to a military tribunal.

entry.title: Egypt pushes for UN-backed intervention against Libya jihadists
Egypt's el-Sissi wants a U.N.-backed coalition on Libya
entry.summary:
Egypt is making an ambitious bid to place itself at the center of the fight against extremism across the Middle East.

CAIRO - Egypt's president said in a radio interview aired on Tuesday that creating a U.N.-backed coalition was the best course of action to rid Libya of Islamic extremists.

entry.title: Analysis: Egypt embarks on ambitious anti-terror campaign
entry.summary: Egypt already has military advisers on the Saudi-Yemeni border tasked mainly with developing a joint strategy with the Saudis to confront future hostilities, according to the officials, who have first-hand knowledge of Egypt's plans.

entry.title: Egypt's el-Sissi wants a UN-backed coalition on Libya
Egypt calls for foreign intervention in Libya
Egypt?s President urges UN mandate for Libya coalition
entry.summary: Egypt directly intervened for the first time in the conflict in neighboring Libya on Monday after an Islamic State group in the country released a video showing the beheading of 21 Egyptian Christians.

entry.title: Egyptian warplanes strike IS targets in Libya, pushes for joint international intervention
entry.summary: Egypt now faces threats on two fronts - a growing stronghold of radicals on its western border and a militant insurgency of Islamic State allies on its eastern flank in the Sinai Peninsula - as well as its own internal challenges.

entry.title: Egypt signs agreements to buy advanced French warplanes 'to serve regional security'
entry.summary: Egyptian Defense Minister Gen. Sedki Sobhi said the weapons would help Egypt boost security and fight terrorism.

entry.title: Egypt bombs Islamic State targets in Libya after 21 Egyptians beheaded
entry.summary:
Egypt's Coptic Christian pope was one of the public figures who backed Sisi when he, as army chief, ousted Islamist president Mohamed Mursi in 2013 after mass protests against him.

Fears the crisis in Libya could spill across the border had already prompted Egypt, the Arab world's most populous nation, to upgrade its military hardware.

entry.title: Egypt signs 5.2 billion-euro deal for French jets, ships and missiles
Egypt strikes Libya jihadists
entry.summary: "More air strikes will be carried out today and tomorrow in coordination with Egypt," he said.

entry.title: Egypt strikes back at Islamic State militants after beheading video, killing dozens
entry.summary: CAIRO: Egypt said it bombed Islamic State targets inside Libya, a day after the group released a video appearing to show the beheading of 21 Egyptians there.

entry.title: Egypt bombs IS Libya targets after killings
Egypt strikes IS group in Libya after video of mass beheading surfaces
entry.summary: Egypt has strongly backed the internationally recognized government, and US officials have said both Egypt and the United Arab Emirates have taken part in a series of mysterious airstrikes targeting Islamist-allied forces.

entry.title: Egypt strikes IS group in Libya after video of mass killing
entry.summary:
The airstrikes bring Egypt overtly into Libya's turmoil, a reflection of Cairo's increasing alarm.

The announcement on state radio represents Egypt's first public acknowledgement of military action in post-Moammar Gadhafi Libya, where there has been almost no government control.

Thirteen of the 21 came from Egypt's tiny Christian-majority village of el-Aour, where relatives wept in church and shouted the names of the dead on Monday.

Without publicly acknowledging it, Egypt and the United Arab Emirates carried out airstrikes against Islamist-allied militias last year, according to U.S. officials.

France, a lead player in the campaign to oust Gadhafi, has campaigned for months for some kind of international action in Libya, and announced a deal Monday to sell fighter jets to Egypt.

entry.title: Egypt launches air strikes against Isil targets in Libya
entry.summary: "Egypt and the whole world are in a fierce battle with extremist groups carrying extremist ideology and sharing the same goals."

entry.title: Ousted Egypt president starts latest trial on spying charge
entry.summary: Morsi, overthrown in July 2013 following mass protests demanding his resignation, does not recognize the court, and insists Egypt's current leadership came to power in a coup d'etat and is thus illegitimate.

entry.title: Ousted Egypt president starts latest trial on spying charge
entry.summary: He was Egypt's first democratically elected leader, but his turbulent one-year rule left the country sharply divided.

entry.title: Gunmen kill policeman in Egypt's Nile Delta
2 Al-Jazeera journalists freed from prison in Egypt
entry.summary: The Al-Jazeera reporters spent over 400 days in prison after being caught in the bitter feud between Egypt and Qatar, main backer of Egypt's Muslim Brotherhood group, from which ousted President Mohammed Morsi hails.

entry.title: Egypt releases 2nd of 3 Al-Jazeera journalists
entry.summary: Since the ouster, Egypt has been cracking down heavily on Morsi's supporters, and the journalists were accused of being mouthpieces for the Brotherhood and falsifying footage to suggest that Egypt faces civil war.

entry.title: 2 Al Jazeera Journalists Freed From Prison in Egypt
entry.summary:
Mohammed was initially sentenced to 10 years in prison and Fahmy to seven years but Egypt's top appeals court subsequently ordered a retrial after overturning the initial ruling, citing "flawed evidence."

Since Morsi's ouster, Egypt has been cracking down heavily on his supporters, and the journalists were accused of being mouthpieces for the Brotherhood.

entry.title: Al Jazeera journalists freed in Egypt
entry.summary: UN Secretary General Ban Ki-moon welcomed their release, urging authorities to free other journalists "in accordance with Egypt's international obligations to protect the freedoms of expression and association".

entry.title: Al Jazeera's Mohamed Fahmy released on bail in Egypt
